item.title: Report E-2025030095
item.description:
Report E-2025030095

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: FREEHOLD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer and an 8’-by-3’ area of roadway. They confirmed that two (2) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon drum due to being punctured while being loaded by the customer. There was one (1) drum of product involved in this release. After assessing the roadway, the truck was taken back to a terminal for additional cleaning. Clean Harbors personnel containerized the remaining product into one drum to be shipped on. They then overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum and used one (1) 55-gallon metal drum to containerize the spent absorbents used in the cleaning of the trailer. Clean Harbors personnel staged the generated waste onsite before departing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030137
item.description:
Report E-2025030137

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: CARTERET
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a pail that was slightly leaking. The pallet the pail was staged on had leaned over during transit causing the pail to hit the trailer wall and crushing the top of the pail and lid consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the crushed pail.
